Content:
Miscellaneous
Israeli Origin Goods prohibited.
Jewelry
Needs original invoice with shipper’s letterhead, stamp, and weight/carats—consignee needs authorization letter.
Food
Requires Dubai Municipality clearance—submit docs and samples; no temp-controlled storage.
Medicine/Vitamins
Needs origin doctor’s report (certified by health ministry) and UAE Ministry of Health approval—commercial needs import permit; no disposal, RTS if unapproved.
MSDS-NON DG
IATA A67 goods (e.g., batteries) need MSDS—advisable for UAE transits; include in shipment and upload to IDIS.
Import Permit
Medical/pharma items need Ministry of Health permit—inspection fees: AED 200 (1-5 pkgs), AED 500 (>5 pkgs); storage AED 30 min or AED 3/kg/day from day 3.
Info About Section Header: This section explains the paperwork needed when bringing goods into the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Jewelry*: Original invoice with stamp, weight—needs consignee letter.
- *Food*: Dubai Municipality approval—submit docs, samples; no cold storage.
- *Meds/Vitamins*: Doctor’s report + UAE permit—commercial needs import permit; RTS if unapproved.
- *MSDS*: Batteries need MSDS—add for UAE transits.
- *Permits*: Meds/pharma need permit—fees: AED 200 (1-5 pkgs), AED 500 (>5); storage AED 30+ from day 3.

Content:
Post Office Boxes
Full address (name, building, street, city) and phone required—no P.O. Boxes; delays if incomplete.
Shipments requiring final clearance in Abu Dhabi Customs
Needs Emirates ID, authorization letter, or EASC ID—varies by consignee type.
Duty and Taxes
Calculated on CIF (cost + freight); ≥AED 300 dutiable; no discount reductions.
Clearance Comments
Commercial importers need valid importer code (AED 330 new, AED 220 renew)—HS code and origin mandatory; extra fees for Sharjah/Saif Zone.
Excise Tax
Carbonated drinks, tobacco, vapes need excise payment—register on Brand-Sync; held until paid.
Non-Documents
Free zone shipments duty-exempt with proper invoice.
VAT Clearance
Link VAT ID to customs code on FTA portal.
Customs Clearance Process
Commercial shipments need business code; individuals need full name/address—15-day clearance or RTS.
Info About Section Header: This section provides details on customs processes in the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Address*: Full details + phone—no P.O. Boxes; delays if missing.
- *Abu Dhabi*: Needs ID, letter, or EASC card—depends on consignee.
- *Importer Code*: Commercial needs code (AED 330 new, AED 220 renew)—HS code + origin required.
- *Excise*: Drinks, tobacco, vapes need tax payment—register on Brand-Sync.
- *Process*: Business code for companies, full name for individuals—clear in 15 days or RTS.

Content:
Service to certain cities—not all areas fully served.
Full address and phone required—no P.O. Boxes.
Rest Days: Saturday, Sunday, holidays.
GMT: +0400
Language: Arabic
Currency: UAE Dirham (AED)
Info About Section Header: This section lists shipping locations in the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Rest Days*: Off Sat, Sun, UAE holidays.

Content:
Duties and Taxes
Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—surcharge if outside UAE.
Shipping Charges
Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—needs account number.
Payment Methods
Only shipper pays by card, check, or cash.
Third-Party Billing
Domestic can’t bill outside UAE unless payor has VAT ID.
Info About Section Header: This section explains payment options for shipping to the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Who Pays*: Duties/taxes to shipper, receiver, or third party—extra fee if outside UAE.
- *Shipping Costs*: Bill to shipper, receiver, or third party—needs account.
- *Payment*: Shipper only for card, check, cash.
- *Third-Party*: UAE-to-UAE can’t bill outside without VAT ID.

Content:
Medical Items/Vitamins/Medicine
Needs permit—RTS after 30 days if uncleared.
Veterinary Products
Needs MOEW approval—RTS after 30 days.
Cosmetics
Needs municipality approval—RTS after 30 days.
Telecom Equipment
Needs TRA approval—RTS after 30 days.
Films/Tapes/Magazines
Needs Ministry of Info approval.
Intercompany Data
CD/USB needs invoice with item value only.
Herbal Medicine
Needs composition listed—RTS after 30 days.
Military Equipment
Needs Ministry of Defense approval—RTS after 30 days.
Food
Needs Dubai Municipality approval—no cold storage; RTS after 30 days.
Info About Section Header: This section lists special rules for shipping goods to the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Food*: Municipality approval—no cold storage; RTS after 30 days.

Content:
Value: 0 AED
Type: No official exemption
Rule: ≤AED 1,000 may be duty-free; >AED 1,000 at 5% CIF
Info About Section Header: This section explains gift tax exemptions in the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Gifts*: No set exemption—≤AED 1,000 may be free; >AED 1,000 pays 5% CIF.

Content:
Paperless Invoice
Accepted for imports, available for exports.
Invoice
1 original + 2 copies—needs HS code, origin, full description, undiscounted CIF value, phone/email; >AED 10,000 needs online attestation (AED 252.21 total).
Info About Section Header: This section details invoice requirements for the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Paperless*: Okay for imports, available for exports.
- *Invoice*: 1 original + 2 copies—add HS code, origin, full details, real CIF, phone/email.
- *High Value*: >AED 10,000 needs online attestation—AED 252.21; 14-day limit or AED 500 fine.

Content: Cash letters, tickets (≤1 kg), intercompany mail (non-commercial, zero value), etc.—over 5 kg needs invoice.
Info About Section Header: This section lists items treated as documents for the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Documents*: Tickets (≤1 kg), zero-value mail—over 5 kg needs invoice.

Content:
Alcohol
Max 2 bottles with Dubai Police permit—RTS if unapproved.
Knives
Only kitchen knives allowed.
Jewelry
Needs invoice with weight—≤$2,500 okay.
Chemicals
Needs Dubai Municipality approval—RTS after 15 days.
Meat
Pork needs approval.
Tobacco/E-Cigs
Banned.
Personal Effects
Not allowed.
Fireworks/Books/Drugs
Banned—books >AED 1,000 dutiable.
Lithium Metal Batteries
Banned via Emirates.
Info About Section Header: This section lists banned or restricted items in the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Alcohol*: ≤2 bottles with permit—RTS if no permit.

Content:
India to UAE
Express Saver, Expedited, Express Freight Midday, Express Plus, Express Freight, Express
Info About Section Header: This section lists shipping services from India to the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *India to UAE*: Pick Express Saver, Expedited, Freight Midday, Plus, Freight, or Express—check UPS.

Content:
Temporary Import
Needs deposit—refunded on re-export.
Military Shipments
Must go to Ministry of Defense with license.
Returned Goods
Needs origin, reason, serial, export number.
Repaired Goods
Needs pre-repair value, repair cost, serial—duty on repair.
Solid Wood Packing Material
ISPM 15 applies—cert for raw wood >6mm.
Exhibition Goods
Needs importer code or exhibitor letter.
Info About Section Header: This section covers special rules for UAE shipments.
Simplified Form: - *Returns*: List origin, reason, serial, export number.
- *Repairs*: List value, repair cost, serial—duty on repair.

Content:
Deminimis: AED 1,000—duty/tax-free below for B2C.
Exports >$1,000 USD need formal clearance from India.
Info About Section Header: This section states value thresholds for the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *High Exports*: >$1,000 USD from India needs formal clearance.

Content:
Max weight: 70 kg (150 lbs.)
Max length: 274 cm (107.9 in.)
Max dimensions: 400 cm (157.5 in.) length + girth
Info About Section Header: This section specifies max weight and size for the UAE.
Simplified Form: - *Size*: Max length 274 cm (107.9 in.), length + girth 400 cm (157.5 in.).
